result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Ryan Scott Reynen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan Scott Reynen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan Scott Reynen was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Ryan Scott Reynen was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today March 7, 2016 no later than 3:00 p.m.
Court notes 3 days credit if revoked.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #15CF377
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 3 Case #15CF377.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Defendant to remain in compliance with AODA treatment.
-Court permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Agent.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser and student intern Kindra Seifert  DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Ryan Scott Reynen appeared.  Case called at 11:11 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a plea and sentencing. State files an amended information. ADA Minser recites agreement. COMPAS evaluation was completed. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 1, 3 & 4 in 15CF377. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct's 1, 3 & 4 charged in the amended information in 15CF377. Court will withhold entry of judgment on Ct. 1 per the 18 month deferred agreement. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF377. Sentencing arguments. ADA Minser has no objection to expungement upon successful completion of probation. DE makes statement. Court approves and signs DJOC on today's date. 20 days to file appeal. Crt orders:

On Ct's 3 and 4:

-   S/W 18 month probation. 3 days jail credit in the event of revocation. Report to probation no later than 3 p.m. today

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This       prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-  Court costs and DNA Surcharge

-  DNA Sample

- DE may apply for expungement upon successful completion of probation

- Remain in compliance with AODA treatment

- Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
Progress Report. km

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Ryan Scott Reynen appeared. Case called at 2:33 p.m. State calls Officer Hecht to the stand. S/T Joshua Hecht, Officer with the Village of Somerset. Direct by ADA Minser. Officer Hecht identifies defendant in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Caton. Moves to strike officer's testimony. Court rules officer's testimony will stand. Redirect by ADA Minser. Officer excused at 2:50 p.m. No more witnesses by either party. Atty Caton gives argument. Moves to dismiss counts 1 and 2. ADA Minser gives argument and asks court to bind defendant over for trial. Court at this time finds that probable cause has been found and binds defendant over for trial. ADA Minser asking for an arraignment date. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Filed by Atty Caton. km
by S. Reynen; 15R 012228.
Atty. J. Caton. gme
Preliminary hearing at 08-18-2015 02:30 pm

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Somerset Music Festival this year, ampitheater and surrounding properties.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Random UA testing permitted at discretion of law enforcement.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Alexis McKinley   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Ryan Scott Reynen appeared from jail. Defendant has copy of complaint. Address and date of birth confirmed.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Speedy trial demand . ADA McKinley gives bond recommendations. Atty Caton reserves on jurisdictional . Gives argument on bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
